t: The Folly of Not Trusting God

Woe*pn to those who go down to Egypt for help, And*ild rely on horses, Who*ld trust in chariots because they*i are*i many, And*ld in horsemen because they are very strong, But*ld who do not look to the Holy One of Israel, Nor*ld seek the Lord!*s
Yet*ld He also is*i wise and will bring disaster, And*ld will not call back His words, But*ld will arise against the house of evildoers, And*ld against the help of those who work iniquity.

Now*ld the Egyptians are*i men, and not God; And*ld their horses are flesh, and not spirit. When*ld the Lord*s stretches out His hand, Both*ld he who helps will fall, And*ld he who is helped will fall down; They*ld all will perish together.

For*p thus the Lord*s has spoken to me: “As*pn a lion roars, And*ld a young lion over his prey (When*ld a multitude of shepherds is summoned against him, He*ild will not be afraid of their voice Nor*ld be disturbed by their noise), So*ld the Lord*s of hosts will come down To*ld fight for Mount Zion and for its hill.
Like*ld birds flying about, So*ld will the Lord*s of hosts defend Jerusalem. Defending,*ld He will also deliver it;*i Passing*ld over, He will preserve it.”*i
Return*p to*i Him*i against whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.
For in that day every man shall throw away his idols of silver and his idols of gold— sin, which your own hands have made for yourselves.
“Then*pn Assyria shall fall by a sword not of man, And*ld a sword not of mankind shall devour him. But*ld he shall flee from the sword, And*ld his young men shall become forced labor.
He*ld shall cross over to his stronghold for fear, And*ld his princes shall be afraid of the banner,” Says*ld the Lord,*s Whose*ld fire is*i in Zion And*ld whose furnace is*i in Jerusalem.
